direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods add HTML content to elements but at different positions (start vs. end).
Both methods set HTML content within elements, though 'html' replaces existing content while 'append' adds to it.
Both methods insert HTML content relative to elements, but 'before' inserts outside the element while 'append' inserts inside.
Both methods insert HTML content relative to elements, but 'after' inserts outside the element while 'append' inserts inside.
Both methods manipulate the structure of elements by adding HTML content, though 'wrap' surrounds the element while 'append' adds content inside.
Both methods manipulate the content of elements, though 'empty' removes all content while 'append' adds content.
Both methods manipulate elements, though 'remove' removes the elements entirely while 'append' modifies their content.
The 'select' method is used to filter elements, which can be a precursor to applying 'append' to a subset of elements.
The 'not' method is used to exclude elements, which can be a precursor to applying 'append' to a subset of elements.
The 'eq' method is used to select a specific element, which can be a precursor to applying 'append' to that specific element.
